alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Montgomery (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 9:42AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL CARROLL AND WEST CENTRAL MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 1015 AM CDT... At 942 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jefferson, or 7 miles north of Carrollton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Carrollton, North Carrollton, and Malmaison around 950 AM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees.
